action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Defense to provide for standardized credentials for law enforcement officers of the Department of Defense, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Defense Law Enforcement Officer Credential Act of 2022.

section.header: Standardized credentials for law enforcement officers of the Department of Defense

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall ensure that—

paragraph.text: the Secretary of each military department develops standardized credentials for Defense law enforcement officers under their respective authority;
the Secretary of each military department issues such credential to each such officer at no cost to such officer; and
any Department of Defense common access card issued to such an officer clearly identifies the officer as a Defense law enforcement officer.

subsection.text: In this section, the term Defense law enforcement officer means a member of the Armed Forces or civilian employee of the Department of Defense who—

paragraph.text: is authorized by law to engage in or supervise the prevention, detection, investigation, or prosecution of, or the incarceration of any person for, any violation of law;
has statutory powers of arrest or apprehension under section 807(b) of title 10, United States Code (article 7(b) of the Uniform Code of Military Justice); and
is authorized by the Department to carry a firearm.
